trans-unit.source: Creating a Cross-Platform Console App with DNX
trans-unit.target: Creating a Cross-Platform Console App with DNX

trans-unit.source: By Steve Smith
trans-unit.target: By Steve Smith

trans-unit.source: Using the .NET Execution environment (DNX), it's very easy to run a simple console application.
trans-unit.target: Using the .NET Execution environment (DNX), it's very easy to run a simple console application.

trans-unit.source: In this article:
trans-unit.target: In this article:

trans-unit.source: Creating a Console App
trans-unit.target: Creating a Console App

trans-unit.source: Specifying Project Settings
trans-unit.target: Specifying Project Settings

trans-unit.source: Running the App
trans-unit.target: Running the App

trans-unit.source: You can <linkText>view and download the source</linkText><title></title> from the project created in this article.
trans-unit.target: You can <linkText>view and download the source</linkText><title></title> from the project created in this article.

trans-unit.source: Creating a Console App
trans-unit.target: Creating a Console App

trans-unit.source: Before you begin, make sure you have successfully installed DNX on your system:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin, make sure you have successfully installed DNX on your system:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Installing on Windows</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Installing on Windows</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Installing on Mac OS X</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Installing on Mac OS X</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Installing on Linux</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Installing on Linux</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Open a console or terminal window in an empty working folder, where dnx is configured.
trans-unit.target: Open a console or terminal window in an empty working folder, where dnx is configured.

trans-unit.source: Creating a console application is extremely straightforward.
trans-unit.target: Creating a console application is extremely straightforward.

trans-unit.source: For this article, we're going to use the following C\# class, which has just one line of executable code:
trans-unit.target: For this article, we're going to use the following C\# class, which has just one line of executable code:

trans-unit.source: It really doesn't get any simpler than this.
trans-unit.target: It really doesn't get any simpler than this.

trans-unit.source: Create a file with these contents and save it as Program.cs in your current folder.
trans-unit.target: Create a file with these contents and save it as Program.cs in your current folder.

trans-unit.source: Specifying Project Settings
trans-unit.target: Specifying Project Settings

trans-unit.source: Next, we need to provide the project settings DNX will use.
trans-unit.target: Next, we need to provide the project settings DNX will use.

trans-unit.source: Create a new project.json file in the same folder, and edit it to match the listing shown here:
trans-unit.target: Create a new project.json file in the same folder, and edit it to match the listing shown here:

trans-unit.source: Save your changes.
trans-unit.target: Save your changes.

trans-unit.source: Running the App
trans-unit.target: Running the App

trans-unit.source: At this point, we're ready to run the app.
trans-unit.target: At this point, we're ready to run the app.

trans-unit.source: You can do this by simply entering `dnx .
trans-unit.target: You can do this by simply entering `dnx .

trans-unit.source: run` from the command prompt.
trans-unit.target: run` from the command prompt.

trans-unit.source: You should see a result like this one:
trans-unit.target: You should see a result like this one:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>image</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>image</linkText>

trans-unit.source: note
trans-unit.target: note

trans-unit.source: dnx references several environment variables, such as DNX_TRACE, that affect its behavior.
trans-unit.target: dnx references several environment variables, such as DNX_TRACE, that affect its behavior.

trans-unit.source: Set the DNX_TRACE environment variable to 1, and run the application again.
trans-unit.target: Set the DNX_TRACE environment variable to 1, and run the application again.

trans-unit.source: You should see a great deal more output:
trans-unit.target: You should see a great deal more output:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>image</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>image</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In this example, running on the Windows platform, the default behavior for DNX is to run on the full .NET Framework.
trans-unit.target: In this example, running on the Windows platform, the default behavior for DNX is to run on the full .NET Framework.

trans-unit.source: You can switch to use the CoreCLR by running dnvm upgrade -r CoreCLR.
trans-unit.target: You can switch to use the CoreCLR by running dnvm upgrade -r CoreCLR.

trans-unit.source: To return to using .NET CLR, run dnvm upgrade -r CLR.
trans-unit.target: To return to using .NET CLR, run dnvm upgrade -r CLR.

trans-unit.source: You can see the app continues to run after switching to use CoreCLR:
trans-unit.target: You can see the app continues to run after switching to use CoreCLR:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>image</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>image</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Summary
trans-unit.target: Summary

trans-unit.source: Creating and running your first console application on DNX is verysimple, and only requires two files.
trans-unit.target: Creating and running your first console application on DNX is verysimple, and only requires two files.
